tagline: Access data and build integrations for this chat app.
description: Connect to the Intercom Customer Service API to access data and build integrations for this chat app. Test an API call and export the code snippet into your app.

args.name: code
args.info: This is automatically passed by the redirect.

args.name: userId
args.info: A unique string identifier for the user.

args.name: customAttributes
args.info: JSON Object, a hash of key - value pairs containing any other data about the user you want Intercom to store.

args.name: lastSeenUserAgent
args.info: The user agent the user last visited your application with.

args.name: companies
args.info: Array of JSON objects of companies.

args.name: lastRequestAt
args.info: The date the user last visited your application

args.name: updateLastRequestAt
args.info: If true, instructs Intercom to update the user's last_request_at value.

args.name: newSession
args.info: If true, instructs Intercom to register the request as a session.

args.name: page
args.info: what page of results to fetch.

args.name: order
args.info: Return the users in ascending or descending order. One of: asc, desc.

args.name: sort
args.info: what field to sort the results by. One of: created_at, last_request_at, signed_up_at, updated_at.

args.name: createdSince
args.info: limit results to users that were created in that last number of days.

blocks.name: getUsersByTag
blocks.description: Fetch segmented users or leads by tag.

args.name: tagId
args.info: The identifier of the tag to filter by.

blocks.name: getUsersBySegment
blocks.description: Fetch segmented users or leads by segment.

args.name: segmentId
args.info: The identifier of the segment to filter by.

args.name: userIdType
args.info: The user identifier type. One of: intercom_id, user_id, email.

args.name: email
args.info: The email you have defined for the Lead.

args.name: phone
args.info: The phone number you have defined for the lead.

args.name: avatarImageUrl
args.info: An avatar URL for the Lead.

args.name: userAgentData
args.info: Data about the last user agent the Lead was seen using.

args.info: Array of JSON objects of companies.

args.name: socialProfiles

args.name: tags
args.info: Array of tags associated with the Lead.

args.info: JSON Object. The custom attributes you have set on the Lead.

args.name: locationData
args.info: JSON Object, of Location, relating to the Lead.

args.info: The identifier of tag to updates.

args.name: adminId
args.info: The identifier of the admin creating the note.

blocks.description: The events belonging to a user.

args.name: type
args.info: Type of counts. One of: user, company, conversation.

blocks.name: createAdminMessage
blocks.description: Create an admin initiated message to a user.

args.name: fromAdminId
args.info: Admin identifier from whom send message.

args.name: receiverType
args.info: Receiver type. One of: user, contact.

args.name: receiverIdType
args.info: The receiver identifier type. One of: intercom_id, user_id, email.

args.name: messageType
args.info: The kind of message being created. One of: inapp, email.

args.name: body
args.info: The content of the message. Plaintext only, HTML is not supported.

args.name: template
args.info: The style of the outgoing message. Only valid for email messages. One of: plain, personal.

args.name: senderIdType
args.info: The sender identifier type. One of: intercom_id, user_id, email.

args.name: body
args.info: The content of the message. Plaintext only, HTML is not supported.

args.info: The sender identifier type. One of: intercom_id, user_id.

args.name: body
args.info: The content of the message. Plaintext only, HTML is not supported.

blocks.name: getConversations
blocks.description: Fetch a list of all conversations.

args.name: open
args.info: when true fetches just open conversations, when false just closed conversations.

args.name: userIdType
args.info: The user identifier type. One of: intercom_user_id, user_id, email.

args.name: body
args.info: The text body of the comment.

args.name: userIdType
args.info: The user identifier type. One of: intercom_user_id, user_id, email.

args.name: attachmentUrls
args.info: Array of Strings of URLs of files that will be added as attachments. You can include up to 5 attachments.

args.name: adminId
args.info: The identifier of the Admin who is authoring the comment.

args.name: body
args.info: The text body of the comment.

args.info: Array of Strings of URLs of files that will be added as attachments. You can include up to 5 attachments.

args.info: The date the lead last visited your application

args.info: An avatar image URL for the Visitor.

args.info: Whether the Visitor is unsubscribed from emails.

args.name: userAgentData

args.name: leadId
args.info: User identifier for the Lead to binding.

args.name: url
args.info: The url the event should be sent to.

args.name: topics
args.info: Comma-separated list of topics to subscribe to.

args.name: serviceType
args.info: The type of the service being called. Default is web.

args.name: hubSecret
args.info: A key used to sign notifications.
